title: ICT-Integrated Mobile Microlearning Design for Secondary Educators in Developing Countries

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: Emphasizing the capacity to design smartphone-based language education in PC-unavailable environments

learning_goals: Learners will be able to apply the five-stage instructional design process (goal setting, content analysis, activity development, assessment planning, implementation validation) when designing ICT-based language lessons.
Learners will be able to structure three or more microlearning activity types (quizzes, audio recordings, image collaboration) usable in smartphone environments according to design tools.

Learners will be able to apply the five core principles validated in Bangladeshi educational settings (contextual relevance, technological accessibility, interactivity, assessment linkage, cultural sensitivity) to actual lessons.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
